intro: Ophiorrhiza kwangsiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi Ophiorrhiza, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Ophiorrhiza kwangsiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
